metadata.title: CVE-2019-16328 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In RPyC 4.1.x through 4.1.1, a remote attacker can dynamically modifyobject attributes to construct a remote procedure call that executes codefor an RPyC service with default configuration settings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16328` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-rpyc - 3.4.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rpyc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.4-1').
